byline.contributor: Jason Grant contributed reporting from Baltimore, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Susan Beachy and Kitty Bennett contributed research.
byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and RON NIXON

abstract: Questions continue to hover over death of Freddie Gray, 25-year-old black man who died after being chased and restrained by Baltimore police officers; case tests whether black leadership can more capably deal with police brutality charges than white-dominated governments like Ferguson, Mo, and North Charleston, SC; Justice Dept opens civil rights inquiry into Gray's death.
lead_paragraph: A city in which both the mayor and the police commissioner are black will be compared with white-governed cities in how it handles the death of Mr. Gray, who was restrained by the police.

headline.main: Freddie Gray in Baltimore: Another City, Another Death in the Public Eye
headline.print_headline: Another City, Another Death in Public Eye

snippet: A city in which both the mayor and the police commissioner are black will be compared with white-governed cities in how it handles the death of Mr. Gray, who was restrained by the police.

keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
